values.value: Designate a Data Protection Officer responsible for overseeing GDPR compliance, advising on data protection impact assessments, and serving as the point of contact for supervisory authorities and data subjects.

Determine if your organization is required to appoint a DPO based on processing activities involving regular systematic monitoring or large-scale processing of special category data. Formally appoint a qualified DPO with expertise in data protection law and practices. Publish the DPO contact details and notify the relevant supervisory authority. Ensure the DPO has independent authority and direct access to senior management.
